thread.title: General Mills recalls 1.8 million boxes of Cheerios
thread.title_full: General Mills recalls 1.8 million boxes of Cheerios - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: General Mills recalls 1.8 million boxes of Cheerios
text:
(CNN) - General Mills is recalling 1.8 million boxes of Cheerios and Honey Nut Cheerios that are labeled gluten-free because the products may contain wheat.
Boxes of either brand that are dated to be used by July 14, 2016, and were manufactured at specific factories are affected by the recall. Affected products can be identified by a product code on the box.
We're so sorry to announce we’re recalling some boxes of Cheerios/Honey Nut Cheerios. Please view image below & share pic.twitter.com/L9gxUutA3j
— Cheerios (@cheerios) October 5, 2015 According to the General Mills, issues at a California facility may have caused the contamination of the products.
Any customers who have wheat allergies and bought the affected products should call the company at 1-800-775-8370.
General Mills is in the process of converting five brands of its Cheerios line to gluten-free cereals .
Copyright 2015 CNN.
